description: From Middle French utile, from Old French utele, from Latin ūtilis.

adjectives.description: utile (comparative more utile, superlative most utile)

examples: technologists (the so-called Eggheads) all over the world were trying to make publicly utile and commercially rewarding the extremely elaborate and still very expensive, hydrodynamic telephones and other miserable gadgets  […]

entries.meaning: (economics) A theoretical unit of measure of utility, for indicating a supposed quantity of satisfaction derived from an economic transaction.
examples: [T]he ‘happiness utile’ does not exist, at least not yet.
